intro: Hello! I'm Nael Fontaine, a computer engineering student at ENSEEIHT in Toulouse.
Welcome to my ePortfolio, where you can learn more about my academic journey, projects, and professional experiences.
eng_course_description: I am currently a second-year student enrolled in the Software Systems program within the Computer Science Department at ENSEEIHT.
The curriculum is structured into semesters, each comprising a set of UEs (teaching units) that I will list below.
Check out the detailed curriculum on the ENSEEIHT website.
This page will be updated each semester to reflect my academic progress.
semester3: Semester 3 (Semester 7 after high school) - Software Systems program
semester1_courses: • Soft & Human Skills(English, Spanish, Sport, Careers and Management)
semester2_courses: • Soft & Human Skills(English, Spanish, Sport, Careers and Management : leadership)
semester3_courses: • Soft & Human Skills(English, Spanish, Sport, Careers and Management)
• Mathematical tools for computer science (proofs) and Graphs
international_mobility_content: For the first semester of 2026, I will go on an exchange program to Bogotá, Colombia, to study at the Universidad Nacional de Colombia.
Studying there will not only allow me to improve my Spanish but also discover a totally new culture.
This university plays an important role in the region and could be a major asset if I participate in joint projects in the future.
This international experience would strengthen my linguistic and intercultural skills while expanding my professional network.
event_net7: Participation in events for the net7 association
net7 is the school’s computer science student association that develops and maintains services for students and clubs.
As a member of net7, I contribute to the development and maintenance of these services and I also participate in 2 supported events:
The THCON (Toulouse Hacking CONvention) is a
cybersecurity conference that brings together hobbyists, professionals and researchers.
The CTL (Capitole du Libre) is an event which promotes free software.
We helped people on an install party to install Linux on their computer.
climbing_wall_oppening: Thanks to the SAE (Artificial Climbing Structure) initiator certification I obtained last year,
I open and supervise regularly the climbing wall at the INP group's gymnasium during my free time.
climbing_section: Climbing has been a significant passion of mine
During my first year at ENSEEIHT, I completed a training to become an SAE Initiator (Artificial Climbing Structure Initiator).
This certification allows me to open and supervise the climbing wall at the INP group's gymnasium during my free time.
This enables students to climb independently after classes.
gaming_section: Passion for Computer Science and Video Games
Beyond my academic pursuits, I really enjoy computer science and video games.
During the summer of 2024, I participated in the GMTK 2024 Game Jam, where I collaborated with some friends to develop a video game
within 4 days. This experience allowed me to apply my programming skills creatively under tight deadlines
impro_section: I am actively involved in "les !mprobables", the improvisational theater club of ENSEEIHT, which has been an incredible experience for me.
I am responsible for managing the club's budget and organizing events.
Participating in improvisational theater has also greatly enhanced my communication skills, spontaneity, and ability to work as part of a team and in front of an audience.
career_intro: Here you will find my professional experiences such as internships.
Feel free to view my CVs and connect with me on LinkedIn for more information.
internships_intro: This section will include all my internship experiences.
internship_onera: During my first year at the ENSEEIHT I completed an internship at ONERA, a national aerospace research center.
I worked on evaluating different formulas in the domain of real-time networks for embedded systems.
I learned a lot in the field of research.
internship_irit: During my time at the Prépa des INP de Toulouse before entering ENSEEIHT,
I completed an internship at IRIT, the institute of research in computer science of Toulouse.
I worked on the development of an interactive game to aid visually impaired children in learning Braille.
